data.title: EA unveils E3 lineup
data.meta_description: Go to GamingNexus.com for news and reviews on video games, consoles, and PCs.
data.text:
by: Chuck -

More On: E3 2009

Like everyone else EA has unveiled their parade of games for this year's E3. Here's the full lineup:

Army of Two:The 40th Day (360, PS3, PSP)

Battlefield: Bad Company 2 (360, PS3, PC)

Brutal Legend (360, PS3)

Dante's Inferno (360, PS3, PSP)

Dead Space Extraction (Wii)

Dragon Age: Origins (360, PS3, PC)

EA Sports Active (Wii)

EA Sports: Grand Slam Tennis (Wii)

FIFA 10 (360, PS3, Wii, PC, PS2, DS, PSP)

Fight Night Round 4 (360, PS3)

GI Joe: The Rise of Cobra (360, PS3, Wii, PS2, PSP, DS)

Harry Potter and the Half Blood Prince (360, PS3, Wii, PS2, PSP, DS, PC/Mac)

Madden NFL 10 (360, PS3, PS2, PSP, Wii)

Mass Effect 2 (360, PC)

Looks like a solid lineup to me. Interesting to see that Mass Effect 2 is still a 360/PC exclusive and that EA is going to make John happy by bringing Battlefield: Bad Company to the PC. After seeing the list I can see why John and I will be spending nearly three hours with EA next week. If there's something you really want coverage on leave it in the comments and we'll see what we can do.
